subject: RE: [junit] In what order are the test run through...

messageBody:
Here's how we did it. We created a TestSetup decorator to add the required
data to the database. Then, each test case can use the data without worrying
about adding it or cleaning it up. The FacadeTestSetup is the TestSetup
class, while FacadeTest contains the individual test cases. In your
situation, you would probably want to add the user in the TestSetup's
setUp() method, and run the testFindUser() in the actual test cases. You
probably do NOT want to make testFindUser() depend on testAddUser(). You can
still run a separate testAddUser(), but write it so that it cleans up after
itself. Good luck!

Here's the FacadeTestSetup:

public class FacadeTestSetup extends TestSetup {
private Connection con;
private long newID[] = {0, 0};

public FacadeTestSetup(Test t) {
super(t);
}

/**
* Adds data to the database for the test cases.
*/
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
Statement s = null;

DriverManager.registerDriver(new oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver());
con = DriverManager.getConnection();

// Add two users to the database
try {
newID[0] = DbUtil.getNextSEQ("sUserID", con);
newID[1] = DbUtil.getNextSEQ("sUserID", con);

s = con.createStatement();
s.executeUpdate("INSERT...");
s.executeUpdate("INSERT...");
}
finally {
if (s != null) s.close();
}
}

/**
* Removes the data that we added in setUp() and closes the database
connection.
*/
protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
Statement s = null;

try {
s = con.createStatement();
s.executeUpdate("DELETE...");
}
finally {
if (s != null) s.close();
if (con != null) con.close();
}
}

And here's a part of the FacadeTest (minus the actual test cases):

public class FacadeTest extends TestCase {

public FacadeTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
String[] testCaseName = {FacadeTest.class.getName()};
junit.swingui.TestRunner.main(testCaseName);
}

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
TestSuite newSuite = new TestSuite(FacadeTest.class);
return new FacadeTestSetup(newSuite);
}
}

Subject: [junit] In what order are the test run through...


Hi all,

I'm testing some classes which leave state in the db. This one is
a user class. So I definitely want to have the test to create the
user before the test to search for the user. AND I'd prefer
to set this up with new TestSuite(User.class) instead of
adding the methods by hand.

Is there a specific ordering of the test runs (or method calls)?
Is the solution to add the test cases by hand?
suite.addTest("testAddUser");
suite.addTest("findUser");

CU

Christian
P.S.: I don't quite get the TestDecorator and couldn't find an example.
A hint is highly appreciated :-)
